text: Hypatima orthomochla is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It was described by Edward Meyrick in 1932. It is found on Java in Indonesia. The wingspan is about 8 mm. The forewings are pale red brownish irrorated (sprinkled) with grey with a few black scales and with about eight small elongate blackish spots along the costa, separated by dots of whitish suffusion. There is a narrow, black, slightly inwards-oblique suffusedly interrupted antemedian fascia, as well as a fine expansible whitish hair-pencil from the base of the dorsum and some black scales at the tornus. The hindwings are grey.Exotic Microlepidoptera. 4 (2-4): 199. ==References== Category:Hypatima Category:Moths described in 1932
title: Hypatima orthomochla
